import Layout from '../components/PagesLayout' export default function index(props) { return (

In Setting the Growth Strategy we talked about using market research and client data to categorize and prioritize potential clients. Segment leadership and strategy teams then develop priority lists to help target our sales efforts. There's another team that acts on these priority targets ...

Digital Marketing

Who is our target?

What's the opportunity?

What's our growth strategy?

{/* image goes here */}

It’s important to note that there is a prequel to the story. Key decision-makers and strategic teams have been doing basic research and developing plans that set the growth strategy and targets for each Segment. These include the teams who did the market research behind Segmentation, Targeting, and Buyer’s Journey Based on the research, Segment leaders have made key decisions about market sub-segmentation, a list of priority accounts by territory, and pricing strategies for competitive excellence. The research and strategic thinking help us focus our sales and marketing efforts, as well more accurately shape specific commercial strategies and support more flexible and responsive solution development. These priorities and strategies set the stage for the story that follows. One of the goals of the Acceler8 effort is to get more efficient and focused about what leads and opportunities we pursue. And that means asking a lot of powerful questions about potential clients and listening hard to the answers. For instance, let’s say our buyer, our potential client, is a self-operated hospital. They run their own cafeteria and facilities. …or it’s a university that has Sodexo food service running their cafeteria, but they're self-operating in facilities management or a competitor is providing them this service. …or it’s a pharmaceutical company that Sodexo supports in one location but not in others. There’s a gap between what Sodexo can deliver and what Sodexo is currently delivering for that account. So there’s an opportunity for Sodexo to offer new or additional services.

Segmentation & Targeting

{/* image goes here */}

What's the value of sub-segmentation?

How do we use it to pursue segment and NorAm growth strategies?

How do we operationalize the sub-segmentation insights?

{/* image goes here */}

Our sales and marketing journey runs parallel to another important concept, the Buyer’s Journey.

One of the ways for Sodexo to close this gap is through Segmentation and Targeting; two strategies that give us data-driven insight into clients and the services and offers they might want to purchase. Self-operating is a part of the client’s profile. That tells us something about them. Each Segment will have a number of sub-segments, based on data collected and analyzed about the market and client. Some sub-segments are more likely to be good targets than others. In the new Acceler8 framework, sub-segmentation helps us identify potential leads and opportunities, which in turn helps us set priority targets for our sales and marketing efforts. Data helps us to organize client needs, priorities, and behaviors into categories and then similar client categories are grouped into clusters. Each cluster is mapped to recommended value propositions, offers, and selling strategies to optimize our sales approach. Accurate data powers our strategies. Currently, a common practice has been to go after whatever opportunities surface, which doesn’t help us focus our efforts or to strategically shape our pipeline. Sub-segmentation, targeting, and prioritization shape our marketing and sales efforts and help us pursue our North America growth strategies. After the sub-segmentation is determined by the Segent CEO and the Segment strategy office, lists of priority accounts are identified and communicated to sales leadership. The segment leadership communicates the priorities to the field sales force, as well as the strategic rationale behind the priorities. Now field sales can go and execute on that strategy, focusing on the right targets and using the profile data to shape their own sales approach. This process makes the sub-segmentation actionable at both the strategic and tactical level. And that relates to one of the KPIs we’re defining for the Acceler8 effort: % of pipeline in priority sub-segments.

) }
